p: Seroprevalence was analysed separately for goats, sheep, cattle, camels and humans. However, seroprevalence was pooled for wildlife due to the large range of species surveyed. The most common species tested was African buffalo ( Syncerus caffer), but other species were sampled including elephants, white and black rhinoceros, giraffe, lions, leopards, lesser kudu, eland, kongoni, gazelle, impala, waterbuck and rodents [ 10, 24â€“ 32].
